segment.source: Understand AppLocker rules and enforcement setting inheritance in Group Policy (Windows 10)
segment.target: Understand AppLocker rules and enforcement setting inheritance in Group Policy (Windows 10)

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how application control policies configured in AppLocker are applied through Group Policy.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how application control policies configured in AppLocker are applied through Group Policy.

segment.source: Understand AppLocker rules and enforcement setting inheritance in Group Policy
segment.target: Understand AppLocker rules and enforcement setting inheritance in Group Policy

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: This topic for the IT professional describes how application control policies configured in AppLocker are applied through Group Policy.
segment.target: This topic for the IT professional describes how application control policies configured in AppLocker are applied through Group Policy.

segment.source: Rule enforcement is applied only to collections of rules, not individual rules.
segment.target: Rule enforcement is applied only to collections of rules, not individual rules.

segment.source: AppLocker divides the rules into the following collections: executable files, Windows Installer files, scripts, packaged apps and packaged app installers, and DLL files.
segment.target: AppLocker divides the rules into the following collections: executable files, Windows Installer files, scripts, packaged apps and packaged app installers, and DLL files.

segment.source: The options for rule enforcement are Not configured, Enforce rules, or Audit only.
segment.target: The options for rule enforcement are Not configured, Enforce rules, or Audit only.

segment.source: Together, all AppLocker rule collections compose the application control policy, or AppLocker policy.
segment.target: Together, all AppLocker rule collections compose the application control policy, or AppLocker policy.

segment.source: Group Policy merges AppLocker policy in two ways:
segment.target: Group Policy merges AppLocker policy in two ways:

segment.source: Rules.
segment.target: Rules.

segment.source: Group Policy does not overwrite or replace rules that are already present in a linked Group Policy Object (GPO).
segment.target: Group Policy does not overwrite or replace rules that are already present in a linked Group Policy Object (GPO).

segment.source: For example, if the current GPO has 12 rules and a linked GPO has 50 rules, 62 rules are applied to all computers that receive the AppLocker policy.
segment.target: For example, if the current GPO has 12 rules and a linked GPO has 50 rules, 62 rules are applied to all computers that receive the AppLocker policy.

segment.source: Important: When determining whether a file is permitted to run, AppLocker processes rules in the following order:
segment.target: Important: When determining whether a file is permitted to run, AppLocker processes rules in the following order:

segment.source: Explicit deny.
segment.target: Explicit deny.

segment.source: An administrator created a rule to deny a file.
segment.target: An administrator created a rule to deny a file.

segment.source: Explicit allow.
segment.target: Explicit allow.

segment.source: An administrator created a rule to allow a file.
segment.target: An administrator created a rule to allow a file.

segment.source: Implicit deny.
segment.target: Implicit deny.

segment.source: This is also called the default deny because all files that are not affected by an allow rule are automatically blocked.
segment.target: This is also called the default deny because all files that are not affected by an allow rule are automatically blocked.

segment.source: Enforcement settings.
segment.target: Enforcement settings.

segment.source: The last write to the policy is applied.
segment.target: The last write to the policy is applied.

segment.source: For example, if a higher-level GPO has the enforcement setting configured to Enforce rules and the closest GPO has the setting configured to Audit only, Audit only is enforced.
segment.target: For example, if a higher-level GPO has the enforcement setting configured to Enforce rules and the closest GPO has the setting configured to Audit only, Audit only is enforced.

segment.source: If enforcement is not configured on the closest GPO, the setting from the closest linked GPO will be enforced.
segment.target: If enforcement is not configured on the closest GPO, the setting from the closest linked GPO will be enforced.

segment.source: Because a computer's effective policy includes rules from each linked GPO, duplicate rules or conflicting rules could be enforced on a user's computer.
segment.target: Because a computer's effective policy includes rules from each linked GPO, duplicate rules or conflicting rules could be enforced on a user's computer.

segment.source: Therefore, you should carefully plan your deployment to ensure that only rules that are necessary are present in a GPO.
segment.target: Therefore, you should carefully plan your deployment to ensure that only rules that are necessary are present in a GPO.

segment.source: The following figure demonstrates how AppLocker rule enforcement is applied through linked GPOs.
segment.target: The following figure demonstrates how AppLocker rule enforcement is applied through linked GPOs.

segment.source: applocker rule enforcement inheritance chart
segment.target: applocker rule enforcement inheritance chart

segment.source: In the preceding illustration, note that all GPOs linked to Contoso are applied in order as configured.
segment.target: In the preceding illustration, note that all GPOs linked to Contoso are applied in order as configured.

segment.source: The rules that are not configured are also applied.
segment.target: The rules that are not configured are also applied.

segment.source: For example, the result of the Contoso and Human Resources GPOs is 33 rules enforced, as shown in the client HR-Term1.
segment.target: For example, the result of the Contoso and Human Resources GPOs is 33 rules enforced, as shown in the client HR-Term1.

segment.source: The Human Resources GPO contains 10 non-configured rules.
segment.target: The Human Resources GPO contains 10 non-configured rules.

segment.source: When the rule collection is configured for Audit only, no rules are enforced.
segment.target: When the rule collection is configured for Audit only, no rules are enforced.

segment.source: When constructing the Group Policy architecture for applying AppLocker policies, it is important to remember:
segment.target: When constructing the Group Policy architecture for applying AppLocker policies, it is important to remember:

segment.source: Rule collections that are not configured will be enforced.
segment.target: Rule collections that are not configured will be enforced.

segment.source: Group Policy does not overwrite or replace rules that are already present in a linked GPO.
segment.target: Group Policy does not overwrite or replace rules that are already present in a linked GPO.

segment.source: AppLocker processes the explicit deny rule configuration before the allow rule configuration.
segment.target: AppLocker processes the explicit deny rule configuration before the allow rule configuration.

segment.source: For rule enforcement, the last write to the GPO is applied.
segment.target: For rule enforcement, the last write to the GPO is applied.
